resources.string: NTruex, togetherness and Talladega: Sunday’s playoff race may hinge on team effort
Texas rattles Cup Series playoff picture once again
The NASCAR Cup Series Playoffs Round of 12 continues at Talladega Superspeedway on Sunday for the YellaWood 500 (2 p.m. ET, NBC, MRN, SiriusXM NASCAR Radio, NBC Sports App).

Martin Truex Jr. is still looking for the first Talladega Superspeedway victory of his career, and snagging one Sunday at a pivotal point in the NASCAR Cup Series Playoffs would be well-timed. The Joe Gibbs Racing veteran is also looking to right the ship in this star-crossed postseason — his four races so far have yet to produce a top-10 finish or a lap led.

Whether it’s Brad Keselowski leading almost every lap only to lose to Jimmie Johnson and not make the Championship 4 or a good old-fashioned donnybrook on pit road with a handful of playoff drivers, Texas Motor Speedway has been at the forefront of postseason theatrics since the inception of the current format in 2014.

NASCAR Cup Series\n\nIn a historic shift for the sport, beginning in 2020 NASCAR’s premier series became known as the NASCAR Cup Series and featured four cornerstone brands as Premier Partners: Busch Beer, Coca-Cola®, GEICO and Xfinity. All four partners are prominently featured in multiple platforms across the sport, including integrations in broadcast, NASCAR digital and social channels, event entitlements, in-market promotions and at-track activations.
